title.native: ひげを剃る。そして女子高生を拾う。
title.romaji: Hige wo Soru. Soshite Joshikousei wo Hirou.
title.english: Higehiro: After Being Rejected, I Shaved and Took in a High School Runaway

description:
On his way home from drinking his sorrows away after being rejected by his crush, the 26 year old salaryman, Yoshida, finds a high school girl named Sayu sitting on the side of the road. Yoshida is completely drunk out of his mind and ends up letting Sayu stay at his place overnight. Not having the heart to put Sayu out on the streets since she ran away from home, Yoshida allows her to stay at his place... And so began the awkward, irritable, and slightly heartwarming relationship between a runaway high school girl and a salaryman living together.

(Source: Crunchyroll)
synonyms: I Shaved My Beard Then Picked Up a High School Girl.
剃须。然后捡到女高中生。
刮掉鬍子的我與撿到的女高中生
โกนหนวดไปทำงาน แล้วกลับบ้านมาพบเธอ

tags.name: Rehabilitation
tags.description: Prominently features the recovery of a character who became incapable of social life or work.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Age Gap
tags.description: Prominently features romantic relations between people with a significant age difference.

tags.name: Bullying
tags.description: Prominently features the use of force for intimidation, often in a school setting.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Konbini
tags.description: Predominantly features a convenience store.

tags.name: Work
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a certain occupation.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Female Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several female characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: Suicide
tags.description: The act or an instance of taking or attempting to take one's own life voluntarily and intentionally.

tags.name: Estranged Family
tags.description: At least one family member of the MC intentionally distances themselves or a family distances themselves from a person related to the MC.

tags.name: Office
tags.description: Features people who work in a business office.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Cohabitation
tags.description: Features two or more people who live in the same household and develop a romantic or sexual relationship.

tags.name: Office Lady
tags.description: Prominently features a female office worker or OL.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Adoption
tags.description: Features a character who has been adopted by someone who is neither of their biological parents.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

tags.name: Rape
tags.description: Features non-consensual sexual penetration.

tags.name: Gyaru
tags.description: Prominently features a female character who has a distinct American-emulated fashion style, such as tanned skin, bleached hair, and excessive makeup. Also known as gal.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Time Skip
tags.description: Features a gap in time used to advance the story.

title.native: ひげを剃る。そして女子高生を拾う。
ひげを剃る。そして女子高生を拾う。

node.description:
[Website](http://hitodama.info/) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/hitodama1103/)

A Japanese singer, songwriter, radio personality and scriptwriter.

She has released 17 singles and 11 albums since her debut as a 13-year-old in 1994. Several of her songs have been used as anime theme songs. She is often mistaken for a voice actress because she is in the same field of activity as idol-esque voice actresses. When she is working as a screenwriter, she goes by the name Deko Akao, an alias made up from her senior [Satoru Akahori](https://anilist.co/staff/97460/)'s name.

Mother of a son and twin daughters.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/明田川仁)

Affiliated with Magic Capsule, a recording studio led by his father [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062).

__[Website](http://kikuyatomoki.com/)__

__Birthplace:__ Mitaka, Tokyo, Japan

__Introduction:__
Tomoki Kikuya is a Japanese composer and arranger, who works for music studio Popholic. His brother Kikuya Hiroki (菊谷宏樹), is the director of TVK's saku saku music show.

__Biography:__
Kikuya started a career as guitarist in the music band Mustang A.K.A under Sony Records. Later he was part of Funanori. Starting from 2005 Kikuya decided to focus on working as a music composer and arranger. He has arranged and composed several songs featured in anime since then, starting with theme songs for Pani Poni Dash.

__Height:__ 153cm

[Profile (Style Cube)](http://stylecube.jp/talents/kaori/index.html) | [Website](http://ishiharakaori.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kaori_staff_) | [Blog](http://ameblo.jp/ishiharakaori/) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/ishiharakaori_official) | [TikTok](https://www.tiktok.com/@kaori_ishihara)

She won the award of Best Rookie Actress in the 7th Seiyuu Awards. She was a founding member of the group [StylipS](https://anilist.co/staff/111177), before her graduation from the group on April 20, 2013. She was one half of J-Pop duo [YuiKaori](https://anilist.co/staff/195974/), along with [Yui Ogura](https://anilist.co/staff/105981/) before the group disbanded in 2017.

__Non-anime roles:__
- Frima - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Soldier EG - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Tiara - Fairy Fencer F (VG)

[Website](https://dialogue-music.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/DIALOGUE_staff) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/dialogue_staff) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/c/DIALOGUEOfficialChannel) | [TikTok](https://www.tiktok.com/@dialogue_official)

DIALOGUE+ is a voice actress unit composed of the following members:

- [Yurina Uchiyama](https://anilist.co/staff/204404/Yurina-Uchiyama)
- [Nene Hieda](https://anilist.co/staff/163903/Nene-Hieda)
- [Kyouka Moriya](https://anilist.co/staff/164774/Kyouka-Moriya)
- [Yuuna Ogata](https://anilist.co/staff/190470/Yuuna-Ogata)
- [Ayaka Takamura](https://anilist.co/staff/204409/Ayaka-Takamura)
- [Satsuki Miyahara](https://anilist.co/staff/204411/Satsuki-Miyahara)
- [Mayu Iizuka](https://anilist.co/staff/166401/Mayu-Iizuka)
- [Manatsu Murakami](https://anilist.co/staff/204420/Manatsu-Murakami)

[Website](http://hitodama.info/) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/hitodama1103/)

A Japanese singer, songwriter, radio personality and scriptwriter.

She has released 17 singles and 11 albums since her debut as a 13-year-old in 1994. Several of her songs have been used as anime theme songs. She is often mistaken for a voice actress because she is in the same field of activity as idol-esque voice actresses. When she is working as a screenwriter, she goes by the name Deko Akao, an alias made up from her senior [Satoru Akahori](https://anilist.co/staff/97460/)'s name.

Mother of a son and twin daughters.
